GUIDELINE1.summary: Don't use tabulators in source files
GUIDELINE1.rationale: Developers who use spaces make more money than those who use tabs. See also: https://stackoverflow.blog/2017/06/15/developers-use-spaces-make-money-use-tabs/
GUIDELINE1.workaround: Please replace all tabulators with spaces and adjust your editor settings accordingly.

GUIDELINE2.summary: Don't use backslashes in include directives
GUIDELINE2.rationale: Non Windows systems may not recognize a backslash as path delimiter.
GUIDELINE2.workaround: Please replace all backslashes with forward slashes in include directives.

GUIDELINE3.summary: Duplicate forward slash in include directive
GUIDELINE3.rationale: Such typos are ignored by most compilers, but they complicate automated refactorings.
GUIDELINE3.workaround: Please remove the redundant forward slash.

GUIDELINE4.summary: The missing space between the preprocessor tokens
GUIDELINE4.rationale: It's necessary to have a space between #include and the following <, as its absence leads to incorrect parentheses counting by lupdate (Qt)
GUIDELINE4.workaround: Please insert a space between #include and the following <

GUIDELINE5.summary: Private function names should start with a leading underscore.
GUIDELINE5.workaround: Please change the function name accordingly.

GUIDELINE6.workaround: Please add a cmake_policy() to the first line of the file.

GUIDELINE7.rationale: Task markers should be used only rarely and temporarily in our code base because they indicate a technical debt. They tend to rot over time and will be forgotton eventually.
GUIDELINE7.workaround: Please finish this task if possible. Remove its marker from our code base either way. Use an issue tracker like JIRA for important tasks.
